Annotation.String: This is the schema definition for the LenovoLogEntry resource.
This is Lenovo extended properties of Lenovo extended log entries information.
Represents the origin of the event leading to the log entry.
The value of this property shall represent the origin of the event leading to the log entry.
Represents whether the event should be Serviced by Lenovo, by the customer, or neither.
The value of this property shall represent whether the event should be Serviced by Lenovo, by the customer, or neither.
Represents the unified event ID across all Lenovo products, including Power, System x and Storage.
The value of this property shall represent the unified event ID across all Lenovo products, including Power, System x and Storage.
Represents the unified message ID which is defined by Lenovo.
The value of this property shall represent the unified message ID which is defined by Lenovo.
Represents whether the log entry is intended to be displayed to normal users.
The value of this property shall represents whether the log entry is intended to be displayed to normal users.
Represents List of FRU information for the Failing FRU(s).
The value of this property shall be an array of objects used to represent list of FRU(s). May be null if not known or if event was not caused by a failing FRU.
Provides a unique, monotonically increasing sequence number for each standard event log.
The value of this property shall provides a unique, monotonically increasing sequence number for each standard event log.
Represents additional details that may be provided for some events.
The value of this property shall be an array used to represent additional details that may be provided for some events. May be null if not available.
Represents list of LED Identifiers for the LEDs affected by this logged event.
The value of this property shall represents list of LED Identifiers for the LEDs affected by this logged event.
Represents the event characteristics.
The value of this property shall represent the event characteristics. Curently, Only two bits are defined :bit0 indicate to move VM away from this server; bit1 is Event indication processing flag.
Describe how the system was impacted.
The value of this property shall describe how the system was impacted.
Represents the event occurred at the local node or from other node.
The value of this property shall represent the event occurred at the local node or from other node.
Represents an 8-byte binary Event ID. Its format shall be 0xhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.
The value of property shall represent an 8-byte binary Event ID. Its format shall be 0xhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.
Represents the path which the event was reported through.

The value of this property shall represent the path which the event was reported through. Each management stack adds a tag so the reporting chain is understood and can be expanded to cover the reporting path using two consecutive colons as a delimiter.
Contains one or multiple related event IDs.
The value of this property shall contain one or multiple related event IDs.
Contains a URL of HTTPS where stores the raw debug data for Trust Source Log.
The value of this property shall contain a URL of HTTPS where stores the raw debug data for Trust Source Log
Contains the Version filed in TSL information.
The value of this property shall contain the Version filed in TSL information.
The total sequence number in both audit and platform log entries.
The value of this property shall provides the total sequence number in both audit and platform log entries.
The severity of this event log.
The value of this property shall provides the severity of this event log. This property only available in SaLog log service.
The status of this event log.
The value of this property shall provides the status of this event log. This property only available in SaLog log service.
The case number of this event log.
The value of this property shall provides the case number of this event log. This property only available in SaLog log service.
This object is used to represent FRU Identifier information.
Represents list of LED Identifiers for the LEDs affected by this logged event.
The value of this property shall represents list of LED Identifiers for the LEDs affected by this logged event.
Represents list of Serial Numbers for the Failing FRU(s).
The value of this property shall represents list of Serial Numbers for the Failing FRU(s). Order of entries in the list corresponds to order in the FailingFRUNumber list.
This object is used to represent affected indicator LED information.
Represents LED Identifier
The value of this property shall represent LED identifier.
Represents the LED state.
The value of this property shall represents the LED state.
LED state is lit
LED state is blinking
LED state is off
LED state is control pattern
This object is used to be a reference to Event resource.
Represents the origin of the event leading to the log entry.
The value of this property shall represent the origin of the event leading to the log entry.
Represents whether the event should be Serviced by Lenovo, by the customer, or neither.
The value of this property shall represent whether the event should be Serviced by Lenovo, by the customer, or neither.
Represents the unified event ID across all Lenovo products, including Power, System x and Storage.
The value of this property shall represent the unified event ID across all Lenovo products, including Power, System x and Storage.
Represents the unified message ID which is defined by Lenovo.
The value of this property shall represent the unified message ID which is defined by Lenovo.
Represents whether the log entry is intended to be displayed to normal users.
The value of this property shall represents whether the log entry is intended to be displayed to normal users.
Represents List of FRU information for the Failing FRU(s).
The value of this property shall be an array of objects used to represent list of FRU(s). May be null if not known or if event was not caused by a failing FRU.
Provides a unique, monotonically increasing sequence number for each standard event log.
The value of this property shall provides a unique, monotonically increasing sequence number for each standard event log.
Represents additional details that may be provided for some events.
The value of this property shall be an array used to represent additional details that may be provided for some events. May be null if not available.
Represents list of LED Identifiers for the LEDs affected by this logged event.
The value of this property shall represents list of LED Identifiers for the LEDs affected by this logged event.
Represents the event characteristics.
The value of this property shall represent the event characteristics. Curently, Only two bits are defined :bit0 indicate to move VM away from this server; bit1 is Event indication processing flag.
Describe how the system was impacted.
The value of this property shall describe how the system was impacted.
Represents the event occurred at the local node or from other node.
The value of this property shall represent the event occurred at the local node or from other node.
Represents an 8-byte binary Event ID. Its format shall be 0xhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.
The value of property shall represent an 8-byte binary Event ID. Its format shall be 0xhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.
Represents the path which the event was reported through.

The value of this property shall represent the path which the event was reported through. Each management stack adds a tag so the reporting chain is understood and can be expanded to cover the reporting path using two consecutive colons as a delimiter.
Contains one or multiple related event IDs.
The value of this property shall contain one or multiple related event IDs.
Contains a URL of HTTPS where stores the raw debug data for Trust Source Log.
The value of this property shall contain a URL of HTTPS where stores the raw debug data for Trust Source Log
Contains the Version filed in TSL information.
The value of this property shall contain the Version filed in TSL information.
The total sequence number in both audit and platform log entries.
The value of this property shall provides the total sequence number in both audit and platform log entries.
The severity of this event log.
The value of this property shall provides the severity of this event log. This property only available in SaLog log service.
The status of this event log.
The value of this property shall provides the status of this event log. This property only available in SaLog log service.
